verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD unto me, Go and get thee a linen girdle, and put it upon thy loins, and put it not in water.
verses.web: LORD said to me, “Go, and buy yourself a linen belt, and put it on your waist, and don’t put it in water.”
verses.ct: The LORD told me, "Go buy yourself a linen belt and wear it around your waist, but don't wash it in water."

verses.kjv: So I got a girdle according to the word of the LORD, and put it on my loins.
verses.web: So I bought a belt according to LORD’s word, and put it on my waist.
verses.ct: So I bought the belt, just as the LORD instructed, and put it around my waist.

verses.kjv: And the word of the LORD came unto me the second time, saying,
verses.web: LORD’s word came to me the second time, saying,
verses.ct: Then the LORD spoke to me a second time:

verses.kjv: Take the girdle that thou hast got, which is upon thy loins, and arise, go to Euphrates, and hide it there in a hole of the rock.
verses.web: “Take the belt that you have bought, which is on your waist, and arise, go to the Euphrates, and hide it there in a cleft of the rock.”
verses.ct: "Take the belt you bought — the one you're wearing — and travel to the Euphrates. Hide it there in a crack in the rocks."

verses.kjv: So I went, and hid it by Euphrates, as the LORD commanded me.
verses.web: So I went and hid it by the Euphrates, as LORD commanded me.
verses.ct: So I went and hid it near the Euphrates, just as the LORD commanded.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass after many days, that the LORD said unto me, Arise, go to Euphrates, and take the girdle from thence, which I commanded thee to hide there.
verses.web: After many days, LORD said to me, “Arise, go to the Euphrates, and take the belt from there, which I commanded you to hide there.”
verses.ct: After a long time had passed, the LORD said to me, "Go back to the Euphrates and retrieve the belt I told you to hide there."

verses.kjv: Then I went to Euphrates, and digged, and took the girdle from the place where I had hid it: and, behold, the girdle was marred, it was profitable for nothing.
verses.web: Then I went to the Euphrates, and dug, and took the belt from the place where I had hidden it; and behold, the belt was ruined. It was profitable for nothing.
verses.ct: So I went back to the Euphrates, dug up the belt from where I had hidden it, and found that it was completely ruined — useless, good for nothing.

verses.kjv: Then the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
verses.web: Then LORD’s word came to me, saying,
verses.ct: Then the LORD spoke to me again:

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD, After this manner will I mar the pride of Judah, and the great pride of Jerusalem.
verses.web: “LORD says, ‘In this way I, will ruin the pride of Judah, and the great pride of Jerusalem.
verses.ct: "This is what the LORD says: In exactly this way, I will ruin the pride of Judah and the towering pride of Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: This evil people, which refuse to hear my words, which walk in the imagination of their heart, and walk after other gods, to serve them, and to worship them, shall even be as this girdle, which is good for nothing.
verses.web: This evil people, who refuse to hear my words, who walk in the stubbornness of their heart, and have gone after other gods to serve them, and to worship them, will even be as this belt, which is profitable for nothing.
verses.ct: These wicked people refuse to listen to my words. They follow the stubbornness of their own hearts and chase after other gods, serving and worshiping them. They will end up just like this belt — completely worthless.

verses.kjv: For as the girdle cleaveth to the loins of a man, so have I caused to cleave unto me the whole house of Israel and the whole house of Judah, saith the LORD; that they might be unto me for a people, and for a name, and for a praise, and for a glory: but they would not hear.
verses.web: For as the belt clings to the waist of a man, so I have caused the whole house of Israel and the whole house of Judah to cling to me,’ says LORD; ‘that they may be to me for a people, for a name, for praise, and for glory; but they would not hear.’
verses.ct: Just as a belt clings tightly to a person's waist, I bound the whole house of Israel and the whole house of Judah close to me," declares the LORD. "I did this so they would be my people — my reputation, my praise, and my glory. But they refused to listen."

verses.kjv: Therefore thou shalt speak unto them this word; Thus saith the LORD God of Israel, Every bottle shall be filled with wine: and they shall say unto thee, Do we not certainly know that every bottle shall be filled with wine?
verses.web: “Therefore you shall speak to them this word: ‘LORD, the God of Israel says, “Every container should be filled with wine.” ’ They will tell you, ‘Do we not certainly know that every container should be filled with wine?’
verses.ct: "So tell them this message: 'The LORD, the God of Israel, says: Every jar should be filled with wine.' They'll respond, 'Obviously! Don't we already know that every jar should be filled with wine?'

verses.kjv: Then shalt thou say unto them, Thus saith the LORD, Behold, I will fill all the inhabitants of this land, even the kings that sit upon David’s throne, and the priests, and the prophets, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, with drunkenness.
verses.web: Then tell them, ‘LORD says, “Behold, I will fill all the inhabitants of this land, even the kings who sit on David’s throne, the priests, the prophets, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, with drunkenness.
verses.ct: Then tell them, 'This is what the LORD says: I am going to fill everyone living in this land with drunkenness — the kings sitting on David's throne, the priests, the prophets, and every person in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And I will dash them one against another, even the fathers and the sons together, saith the LORD: I will not pity, nor spare, nor have mercy, but destroy them.
verses.web: I will dash them one against another, even the fathers and the sons together,” says LORD: “I will not pity, spare, or have compassion, that I should not destroy them.” ’ ”
verses.ct: I will smash them against each other, fathers and sons alike,' declares the LORD. 'I will show no pity, no mercy, and no compassion. Nothing will stop me from destroying them.'"

verses.kjv: Hear ye, and give ear; be not proud: for the LORD hath spoken.
verses.web: Hear, and give ear. Don’t be proud, for LORD has spoken.
verses.ct: Listen carefully and pay attention. Don't be proud, because the LORD has spoken.

verses.kjv: Give glory to the LORD your God, before he cause darkness, and before your feet stumble upon the dark mountains, and, while ye look for light, he turn it into the shadow of death, and make it gross darkness.
verses.web: Give glory to LORD your God, before he causes darkness, and before your feet stumble on the dark mountains, and while you look for light, he turns it into the shadow of death, and makes it deep darkness.
verses.ct: Give glory to the LORD your God before he brings darkness — before your feet stumble on the dark mountains. You'll be hoping for light, but he will turn it into the shadow of death and deep, impenetrable darkness.

verses.kjv: But if ye will not hear it, my soul shall weep in secret places for your pride; and mine eye shall weep sore, and run down with tears, because the LORD’s flock is carried away captive.
verses.web: But if you will not hear it, my soul will weep in secret for your pride. My eye will weep bitterly, and run down with tears, because LORD’s flock has been taken captive.
verses.ct: But if you refuse to listen, my soul will weep in secret over your pride. My eyes will overflow with bitter tears, because the LORD's flock has been dragged away into captivity.

verses.kjv: Say unto the king and to the queen, Humble yourselves, sit down: for your principalities shall come down, even the crown of your glory.
verses.web: Say to the king and to the queen mother, “Humble yourselves. Sit down, for your crowns have come down, even the crown of your glory.
verses.ct: Say to the king and the queen mother, "Humble yourselves and sit down, because your crowns are coming off your heads — your glorious crowns are falling."

verses.kjv: The cities of the south shall be shut up, and none shall open them: Judah shall be carried away captive all of it, it shall be wholly carried away captive.
verses.web: The cities of the South are shut up, and there is no one to open them. Judah is carried away captive: all of them. They are wholly carried away captive.
verses.ct: The cities in the south are locked shut, and no one can open them. All of Judah is being carried off into exile — every last person, taken captive.

verses.kjv: Lift up your eyes, and behold them that come from the north: where is the flock that was given thee, thy beautiful flock?
verses.web: Lift up your eyes, and see those who come from the north. Where is the flock that was given to you, your beautiful flock?
verses.ct: Look up and see the armies coming from the north! Where is the flock that was entrusted to you — your beautiful flock?

verses.kjv: What wilt thou say when he shall punish thee? for thou hast taught them to be captains, and as chief over thee: shall not sorrows take thee, as a woman in travail?
verses.web: What will you say, when he sets over you as head those whom you have yourself taught to be friends to you? Won’t sorrows take hold of you, as of a woman in travail?
verses.ct: What will you say when God punishes you? You trained these people to be your allies, and now he's setting them over you as rulers. Won't agony seize you like a woman in labor?

verses.kjv: And if thou say in thine heart, Wherefore come these things upon me? For the greatness of thine iniquity are thy skirts discovered, and thy heels made bare.
verses.web: If you say in your heart, “Why have these things come on me?” Your skirts are uncovered because of the greatness of your iniquity, and your heels suffer violence.
verses.ct: If you ask yourself, "Why is all this happening to me?" — it's because your sin is so enormous that you've been stripped and exposed, left to suffer shame and violence.

verses.kjv: Can the Ethiopian change his skin, or the leopard his spots? then may ye also do good, that are accustomed to do evil.
verses.web: Can the Ethiopian change his skin, or the leopard his spots? Then may you also do good, who are accustomed to do evil.
verses.ct: Can an Ethiopian change the color of his skin? Can a leopard get rid of its spots? Neither can you do good — you who are so practiced at doing evil.

verses.kjv: Therefore will I scatter them as the stubble that passeth away by the wind of the wilderness.
verses.web: “Therefore I will scatter them, as the stubble that passes away, by the wind of the wilderness.
verses.ct: "So I will scatter you like straw blown away by a desert wind.

verses.kjv: This is thy lot, the portion of thy measures from me, saith the LORD; because thou hast forgotten me, and trusted in falsehood.
verses.web: This is your lot, the portion measured to you from me,” says LORD, “because you have forgotten me, and trusted in falsehood.”
verses.ct: This is what you deserve — the fate I have measured out for you," declares the LORD, "because you have forgotten me and put your trust in lies."

verses.kjv: Therefore will I discover thy skirts upon thy face, that thy shame may appear.
verses.web: Therefore I will also uncover your skirts on your face, and your shame will appear.
verses.ct: "I myself will strip your skirts up over your face so your shame is exposed for everyone to see.

verses.kjv: I have seen thine adulteries, and thy neighings, the lewdness of thy whoredom, and thine abominations on the hills in the fields. Woe unto thee, O Jerusalem! wilt thou not be made clean? when shall it once be?
verses.web: I have seen your abominations, even your adulteries, and your neighing, the lewdness of your prostitution, on the hills in the field. Woe to you, Jerusalem! You will not be made clean. How long will it yet be?”
verses.ct: I have seen your adultery, your lustful cravings, and the disgusting acts of your prostitution — your abominations committed on the hills and in the fields. How terrible for you, Jerusalem! You refuse to be made clean. How much longer will this go on?"
